diff_hunk:
@@ -14,7 +14,8 @@
 
       after(:create) do |draft|
         draft.students.each do |student|
-          student.update(attributes_for :student, :applicant)
+          student_update_attributes = (attributes_for :student, :applicant).except(:github_handle)
+          student.update(student_update_attributes)
body:
Great catch!

I wonder if there would be a way to clean this up so as to not have the application draft know about `github_handle`s. This separation of concerns allows the application draft be more future proof in case we decide to forgo github for a new up and coming open source platform.

What do you think?
body_html:
Great catch!

I wonder if there would be a way to clean this up so as to not have the application draft know about github_handles. This separation of concerns allows the application draft be more future proof in case we decide to forgo github for a new up and coming open source platform.

What do you think?
body_text:
Great catch!
I wonder if there would be a way to clean this up so as to not have the application draft know about github_handles. This separation of concerns allows the application draft be more future proof in case we decide to forgo github for a new up and coming open source platform.
What do you think?
